title: More Minimum-Wage Backfires
text:
Wal-Mart earnings dip, while unions win wage-law exemptions. Aug. 25, 2015 7:20 p.m. ET 
The campaign for higher minimum wages continues to inflict damage on business employees and owners. About the only ones not feeling the pain are the labor unions that back this movement. Meanwhile, in a growing number of U.S. jurisdictions, unions are succeeding in exempting themselves from the laws they seek to impose on everyone else. 
Wal-Mart announced last week that second quarter operating income was down 10% compared to the same period last year, even as revenue was slightly higher. Wal-Mart, a non-union shop under... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
